properties.name: Advice
properties.location: Yarra River from Warrandyte to Abbotsford
properties.webBody:
This Minor Flood Warning is being issued for Yarra River from Warrandyte to Abbotsford.

The Yarra River catchment has recorded no significant rainfall since 09:00 AM Monday 09 October 2023. Rainfall totals of 0-1 mm are forecast for the catchment for Tuesday 10 October 2023.

Yarra River from Warrandyte to Abbotsford: The level of the Yarra River at Abbotsford is currently at 1.73 metres, below the Minor Flood Level (2.70 metres) and falling. It peaked below the Minor Flood Level yesterday evening. 

Minor flooding in the Yarra catchment is affecting low-lying areas adjacent to the waterway including bicycle paths.
Stay informed - monitor your local conditions and remain alert.
What you should do: 

  • Be prepared to act if your situation changes.
  • You should stay informed by listening to emergency broadcasters and monitoring warnings.
  • Floodwater is toxic - never play or swim in floodwater.
  • Monitor weather forecasts and river levels. Go to www.bom.gov.au/vic/warnings/
Impacts in your area: 

  • High river levels and potential flooding in areas close to rivers and streams.
  • Stagnant water can be harmful to your health. Donâ€™t swim, drink or wash in stagnant water.
  • Parks, hiking tracks and campgrounds are closed due to flooding. To find out more go to www.parkweb.vic.gov.au/safety/flood-affected-parks.
This message was issued by State Emergency Service.

The next update is expected by 11/10/2023 11:30 am or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfloods)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.

Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline. 
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.location: Golden Beach, Loch Sport, Paradise Beach, Seacombe, Banksia Peninsula, Dutson Downs, Goon Nure, Hollands Landing, Lake Wellington, Meerlieu, Ocean Grange
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for Dutson Downs, Golden Beach, Goon Nure, Hollands Landing, Lake Wellington, Loch Sport, Meerlieu, Ocean Grange, Paradise Beach, Seacombe, Banksia Peninsula. 

  • Firefighters are working on several hot spots, clearing debris around the fire affected area and removing any identified hazardous trees. 
  • Please obey all traffic management signage and directions and slow down to 40 km per hour when passing emergency vehicles.  This is for your own safety and for the safety of our firefighter.
  • Smoke will be visible from nearby communities and roads.
  • Recent rainfall has assisted with fire suppression, however communities need to remain aware of fires near them and monitor changes in conditions. 
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Department of Environment, Land, Water & Planning.

The next update is expected by 11/10/2023 12:20 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.  
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
Minor Flood Warning for the Latrobe River

MINOR FLOODING TO CONTINUE AT ROSEDALE FOR THE NEXT FEW DAYS

Minor flooding to continue at Rosedale for the next few days 

No significant rainfall has been recorded in the 24 hours to 9 am Monday in the Latrobe catchment. No significant rainfall is forecast for the next few days.

Latrobe River downstream of Traralgon:

Minor flooding is continuing along the Latrobe River downstream of Traralgon.

The Latrobe River at Rosedale (Main Stream) is currently at 4.33 metres and steady, above the minor flood level (4.00 m). The Latrobe River at Rosedale (Main Stream) is likely to remain above the minor flood level for the next few days.

Flood Safety Advice:

SES advises that all community members should:
  • Never walk, ride or drive through floodwater, Never allow children to play in floodwater, Stay away from waterways and stormwater drains during and after heavy rain.
  • Keep well clear of fallen power lines
  • Be aware that in fire affected areas, rainfall run-off into waterways may contain debris such as ash, soil, trees and rocks, and heavy rainfall increases the potential for landslides and debris across roads. 

Current Emergency Information is available at
http://emergency.vic.gov.au 
For emergency assistance contact the SES on 132 500.
Current Road and Traffic Information is available at the VicTraffic website: http://traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/ Next Issue:
The next warning will be issued by 11:30 am EDT on Monday 09 October 2023.
Stay informed - monitor your local conditions and remain alert.
What you should do: 

  • Farmers should consider moving livestock and machinery to higher ground.
  • Be prepared to act if your situation changes.
  • You should stay informed by listening to emergency broadcasters and monitoring warnings.
  • Floodwater is toxic - never play or swim in floodwater.
  • Floodwater is dangerous - never drive, walk or ride through floodwater.
Impacts in your area: 

  • Boating in floodwaters is dangerous due to debris, submerged trees and other hidden dangers. 
  • High river levels and potential flooding in areas close to rivers and streams.
  • Stagnant water can be harmful to your health. Donâ€™t swim, drink or wash in stagnant water.
  • For more information on road closures check the VicRoads website traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au.
This message was issued by State Emergency Service.

The next update is expected by 11/10/2023 12:30 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfloods)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.

Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
Community Contacts  (click for community contacts)
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline. 
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: Yarra River from Coldstream to Warrandyte
properties.webBody:
This Minor Flood Warning is being issued for the 
Yarra River from Coldstream to Warrandyte

The Yarra River catchment has recorded no significant rainfall since 09:00 AM Monday 09 October 2023. Rainfall totals of 0-1 mm are forecast for the catchment for Tuesday 10 October 2023.

Water levels in the Yarra River and Watts Rivers at various locations are continuing to recede after last weeks rain event. 

Yarra River from Coldstream to Warrandyte: The level of the Yarra River at Yarra Glen is currently at 4.22 metres, exceeding the Minor Flood Level (4.10 metres). It is expected to drop below the Minor Flood Level overnight. 

Minor flooding in the Yarra catchment is affecting low-lying areas adjacent to the waterway including bicycle paths. 
Stay informed - monitor your local conditions and remain alert.
What you should do: 

  • Be prepared to act if your situation changes.
  • You should stay informed by listening to emergency broadcasters and monitoring warnings.
  • Floodwater is toxic - never play or swim in floodwater.
Impacts in your area:

  • Minor flooding in the Yarra catchment is expected to affect low-lying areas adjacent to the waterway including bicycle paths.
  • High river levels and potential flooding in areas close to rivers and streams.
This message was issued by State Emergency Service.

The next update is expected by 11/10/2023 11:30 am or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfloods)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.

Accessibility:

  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Minor Flood Warning is being issued for Thomson River downstream of Wandocka.

MINOR FLOODING CONTINUES TO EASE AT SALE WHARF

Minor flooding is slowly easing along the Thomson River at Sale Wharf.

No significant rainfall has been recorded in the 24 hours to 9:00 am Tuesday.
Rainfall totals of 2-10 mm are forecast across the Thomson River catchment for Thursday with isolated higher totals of 15-20 mm possible.

Thomson River downstream of Wandocka:

Minor flooding is easing along the Thomson River downstream of Wandocka.

The Thomson River at Sale Wharf is currently at 2.57 metres and falling, with minor flooding. 
The Thomson River at Sale Wharf is likely to remain above the minor flood level (2.40 m) for the remainder of Tuesday.

The river level may fall below the minor flood level Wednesday morning.
Stay informed - monitor your local conditions and remain alert.
What you should do: 

  • Farmers should consider moving livestock and machinery to higher ground.
  • Be prepared to act if your situation changes.
  • You should stay informed by listening to emergency broadcasters and monitoring warnings.
Impacts in your area: 

  • High river levels and potential flooding in areas close to rivers and streams.
  • Caravan parks and camping grounds may be flooded.
  • Heavy rainfall may lead to an increased risk of landslides â€“ be aware of fallen earth, rocks, debris or trees.
  • Boating in floodwaters is dangerous due to debris, submerged trees and other hidden dangers. 
This message was issued by State Emergency Service.

The next update is expected by 11/10/2023 11:30 am or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfloods)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.

Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline. 
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: the Goulburn River from Lake Eildon to Seymour
properties.webBody:
This Minor Flood Warning is being issued for Goulburn River from Eildon to Seymour.

MINOR FLOODING CONTINUES DOWNSTREAM OF LAKE EILDON AND SEYMOUR

Minor flooding is continuing along the Goulburn River Downstream (D/S) of Lake Eildon, Trawool and Seymour. 

Goulburn Murray Water has advised the releases from Lake Eildon are likely to remain around 17,000 ML/d during for the remainder of Tuesday and Wednesday. 

No significant rainfall has been observed since 9:00 am Monday. No significant rainfall is forecast for thenext 24 hours.

Goulburn River Lake Eildon to Seymour:

Minor flooding is continuing along the Goulburn River from D/S Lake Eildon to Seymour. Minor flooding is easing at Trawool.The Goulburn River D/S Lake Eildon is currently at 3.44 metres and steady, with minor flooding. 

Based on Goulburn Murray Water's planned releases from Lake Eildon, the Goulburn River D/S Lake Eildon is likely to remain above the minor flood level (3.00 metres) for the remainder of Tuesday and Wednesday.

The Goulburn River at Seymour is currently at 3.92 metres and falling slowly, with minor flooding. 

The Goulburn River at Seymour is likely to remain above the minor flood level (3.80 m) for the remainder of Tuesday into Wednesday.
Stay informed - monitor your local conditions and remain alert.
What you should do: 

  • Floodwater is dangerous - never drive, walk or ride through floodwater.
  • Be prepared to act if your situation changes.
  • You should stay informed by listening to emergency broadcasters and monitoring warnings.
  • Review your emergency plan and check your emergency kit is fully stocked, if you have one.
  • Contact family members and neighbours to ensure they are aware of the situation.
  • Farmers should consider moving livestock, pumps and machinery to higher ground.
Impacts in your area: 

  • High river levels and potential flooding in areas close to rivers and streams.
  • Parks, hiking tracks and campgrounds are closed due to flooding. To find out more go to www.parkweb.vic.gov.au/safety/flood-affected-parks.
  • The Goulburn River Caravan Park at Seymour may start to flood low lying parts.
  • The Caravan Parks at Molesworth and the Breakaway Caravan Park at Acheron has enacted their emergency plans.
  • Localised flooding along the river frontage between Kings Park and the old Hume Highway.   
This message was issued by State Emergency Service.

The next update is expected by 11/10/2023 12:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfloods)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.

Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline. 
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.location: Culloden, Fernbank, Glenaladale, Hunter Corner, Iguana Creek, Moornapa, Munro, Stockdale, Walpa, Woodglen, Briagolong, Cobbannah, Lindenow South
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for Briagolong, Cobbannah, Culloden, Fernbank, Glenaladale, Hunter Corner, Iguana Creek, Lindenow South, Moornapa, Munro, Stockdale, Walpa, Woodglen and surrounding areas.

  • The bushfire at Duffy Rd, Briagolong is not yet under control.
  • Recent rain has dampened fire activity. However, there is still active fire within the area as logs and trees continue to burn.
  • You may see isolated pockets of flames and smoke over the burnt area.
  • Firefighters are monitoring the area.
  • Several roads are still closed due to active fire and hazardous trees.
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.

Community Meetings are planned for the following areas;

Tuesday 10/10/23 - Valencia Creek Hall at 5:30pm

Tuesday 10/10/23 - Briagolong Hall at 7:30pm

Wednesday 11/10/23 - Glenaladale Recreation Reserve at 7:00pm 
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 11/10/2023 03:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.  
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

However, there is still active fire within the area as logs and trees continue to burn. - You may see isolated pockets of flames and smoke over the burnt area. - Firefighters are monitoring the area. - Several roads are still closed due to active fire and hazardous trees. - Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures. There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required. Community Meetings are planned for the following areas; Tuesday 10/10/23 - Valencia Creek Hall at 5:30pm Tuesday 10/10/23 - Briagolong Hall at 7:30pm Wednesday 11/10/23 - Glenaladale Recreation Reserve at 7:00pm
